name: cfschedule
description: Provides a programmatic interface to the CFML scheduling engine. Can run a CFML page at scheduled intervals, with the option to write the page output to a static HTML page. This feature enables you to schedule pages that publish data, such as reports, without waiting while a database transaction is performed to populate the page.

params.name: action
params.description:
delete: deletes the specified task
 update: updates an existing task or creates a new task, if one with the name specified by the task attribute does not exist
 run: executes the specified task
 pause: Pauses the specified task.
 resume: Continues executing the specified task.
 list: Lists all the scheduled tasks.
 pauseall: CF10+ Pauses all scheduled tasks.
 resumeall: CF10+ Resume all scheduled tasks for a particular application.
 create: CF2018u2+ Create a fresh task. If a task already exists, an error is thrown.
 modify: CF2018u2+ Modifies an existing task while retaining its old values.

params.name: task
params.description: Name of the task. Not required if action attribute is set to list, otherwise it is required.

params.name: operation
params.description: Operation that the scheduler performs. Must be HTTPRequest.

params.name: file
params.description: Name of the file in which to store the published output of the scheduled task.

params.name: path
params.description:
Path to the directory in which to put the published file.
NOTE: This is Required if `publish` is "Yes".

params.name: startdate
params.description: Date on which to first run the scheduled task.

params.name: starttime
params.description: Time at which to run the scheduled of task starts.

params.name: URL
params.description: URL of the page to execute.

params.name: port
params.description: Port to use on the server that is specified by the url parameter. If resolveURL = "yes", retrieved document URLs that specify a port number are automatically resolved, to preserve links in the retrieved document. A port value in the url attribute overrides this value.

params.name: publish
params.description:
Yes: save the result to a file
 No: does not

params.name: endDate
params.description: Date when scheduled task ends.

params.name: endTime
params.description: Time when scheduled task ends (seconds).

params.name: interval
params.description:
Interval at which task is scheduled.
 * number of seconds (minimum is 60)
 * once
 * daily
 * weekly
 * monthly

params.name: requesttimeout
params.description: Deprecated as of CF11+, Removed in CF2018 Used to extend the default timeout period.

params.name: username
params.description: Username, if URL is protected.

params.name: password
params.description: Password, if URL is protected.

params.name: proxyserver
params.description: Host name or IP address of a proxy server.

params.name: proxyport
params.description: Port number to use on the proxy server.

params.name: proxyuser
params.description: User name to provide to the proxy server.

params.name: proxypassword
params.description: Password to provide to the proxy server.

params.name: resolveurl
params.description:
Yes: resolve links in the output page to absolute references
 No: does not

params.name: group
params.description: CF11+ The group to which the scheduled task belongs.

params.name: mode
params.description: CF10+ If the task is server-specific or application specific.

params.name: result (CF10+)/returnvariable (lucee)
params.description:
Name for the query in which cfschedule returns the result variables.
NOTE: Required for `action`="list"

params.name: eventHandler
params.description:
CF10+ A CFC file which implements CFIDE.scheduler.ITaskEventHandler and is invoked for events while running the task.
 Note: CF 2018 Enterprise Required; not supported in Standard Edition

params.name: onException
params.description:
CF10+ Specify the action to take if a task results in error.
 Note: CF 2018 Enterprise Required; not supported in Standard Edition

params.name: onComplete
params.description:
CF10+ The action or task to perform after completion of the current task. Can be used to chain dependent tasks by executing a task after this task completes.
 Note: CF 2018 Enterprise Required; not supported in Standard Edition

params.name: onMisfire
params.description:
CF10+ Specify what to do if a task misfires. If unspecified, then no action is taken.
 Note: CF 2018 Enterprise Required; not supported in Standard Edition

params.name: cronTime
params.description: CF10+ Schedule the task time in cron job syntax.

params.name: repeat
params.description: CF10+ Specify the number of times a given schedule has to repeat.

params.name: retryCount
params.description: CF10+ Specify the number of times to retry the task if the task fails. Must be between 0 and 3, inclusive.

params.name: priority
params.description: CF10+ Set the priority of this task.

params.name: exclude
params.description: CF10+ Comma-separated list of dates or date range on which to not execute the scheduled task.

params.name: cluster
params.description:
CF10+ If yes, the task can be executed in a cluster setup.
 Note: CF 2018 Enterprise Required; not supported in Standard Edition

params.name: overwrite
params.description: CF10+ Specify whether to overwrite the output files on task execution (if true) or create new output files (if false).

params.name: unique
params.description: lucee4.5+ If true, the scheduled task is only executed once at time. If a task is still running from previous round no new task is started.

params.name: autodelete
params.description: lucee4.5+ If set to true, the scheduled task will be deleted when there is no possible future execution.

params.name: readonly
params.description: lucee4.5+ If true, the scheduled task can not be modified or deleted in the Lucee Administrator.

examples.title: Create or update a task
examples.description: Tell ColdFusion to run 'importData.cfm' daily at 7AM
examples.code:
<cfschedule
 action="update"
 task="importMyCSVFileToDB"
 operation="HTTPRequest"
 startDate="5/12/2016"
 startTime="7:00 AM"
 url="http://www.mydomain.com/scheduled/importData.cfm"
 interval="daily" />
